status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c1au","text":"Tissue preparation: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"718v1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dae1q","text":"Collect approximately 1 g of thallus tissue grown for 4-6 weeks under low light intensity (approximately 0.1 g of tissue per petri dish - 10 petri dishes in total). Figure1 and Figure 3.1","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":165,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tvf2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n36e","text":"Transfer the tissue into an empty petri dish,  add sterile water until the tissue is covered and fragment using a razor blade (it takes approximately 5 mins, similar to Video 1). Figure 3.2-3","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":179,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mdkb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hk86","text":"Transfer the tissue  from the petri dish into a cell strainer positioned on a falcon tube using sterile scalpels and wash the tissue using ~100 ml of sterile water or until the flow through was clear. Figure 3.4-6","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":201,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjsep","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"affle","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1l0t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ok0p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0tkn","text":"Agrobacterium culture preparation:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uorq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgcio","text":"Inoculate 5 mL LB media with 3-4 Agrobacterium colonies (AGL1: 15 μg/mL rifampicin, 50 μg/mL carbenicillin) (GV3101: 50 μg/mL rifampicin, 25 μg/mL gentamicin) and the plasmid-specific selection antibiotic. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":33,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":57,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":109,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70v5r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pp26","text":"Incubate the preculture at 28°C for 2 days at 110 rpm.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"giul","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4u12","text":"Centrifuge 5 mL of 2 d Agrobacterium culture (no need to measure OD) for 7 min at 2000 xg.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":23,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lfqc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2p1bb","text":"Remove supernatant and re-suspend in 5 mL liquid KNOP plus 1% (w/v) sucrose and 100 μM acetosyringone.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qeri","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"he85","text":"Incubate the culture with shaking (120 rpm) at 28°C for 3-5 hours.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cr8q","text":"Co-cultivation:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"coqbv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s2dn","text":"Transferred the fragmented thallus tissue into a 6-well plate (transfer 1⁄6 of the 1 g tissue into a single well) with 5 mL of liquid KNOP medium supplemented with 1% (w/v) sucrose and 30-40 mM MES (VERY IMPORTANT), pH 5.5, 80 μL of Agrobacterium culture and acetosyringone at final concentration of 100 μM.  Figure 3.7","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":185,"length":37},{"style":"bold","offset":309,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":233,"length":14},{"style":"sup","offset":308,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kasv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epvsr","text":"Co-cultivate the tissue with the Agrobacterium for 3 days on a shaker at 110 rpm, with only ambient light.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":33,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qcpt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhejh","text":"Using a sterile plastic pipette transfer the tissue of one well  into a cell strainer, drain and then transfer on growth media containing the appropriate antibiotic (onto 1 petri dish from one well).To facilitate spreading of the tissue, 1-2 mL of sterile water is added to the petri dish.  Figure 3.8-11","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":291,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2eig6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6r30d","text":"After 6-7 weeks successful transformants are visible on the petri dish (successful transformants can be identified using a dissecting scope after 4 weeks  selection (sometimes as early as 2 weeks) based on rhizoid production and/or fluorescence if such a marker is present on the construct).  Figure 3.12","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":293,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3q8v9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5htsu","text":"The emergence of rhizoids is an indication of successful transformation (yellow arrow: transformed thallus fragment, blue arrow: dying thallus fragment).  Figure 4","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":155,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"385lh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8l9o","text":"    ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ft0j4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"21E62C54136D11EDB1220A58A9FEAC02","height":"429","id":"21D4F180136D11EDB112E3CFF09B6D48","is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cr7sl","text":" Example of plate with successful transformants 8 weeks after co-cultivation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/aMgntRyVNagV4AQpIVHKYOvve2JrVmI8-Cv3385GgEWJ3YntuLsT8z-Ob1Voz0gCff9cl6EIxuZ3jkSkkHKhE9zpsBqRMhRrg8kNz-2zGaSXe1i3M_d2HkOQV1mQ2gPEwFLrirtXGx9wWZDfCNrm6NQ","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/aMgntRyVNagV4AQpIVHKYOvve2JrVmI8-Cv3385GgEWJ3YntuLsT8z-Ob1Voz0gCff9cl6EIxuZ3jkSkkHKhE9zpsBqRMhRrg8kNz-2zGaSXe1i3M_d2HkOQV1mQ2gPEwFLrirtXGx9wWZDfCNrm6NQ","width":"433"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34k6r","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f530b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AE836390136E11EDB112E3CFF09B6D48","height":500,"id":280402,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":39,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":13,"offset":299,"style":"italic"}],"key":"897v6","text":"Figure 2: Transformation method outline. A) Thallus tissue is routinely propagated on a monthly basis under low light. 4-6 week old tissue is fragmented with the aid of a razor blade, transferred to a cell strainer, and washed thoroughly with sterile water. B) The tissue is then co-cultivated with Agrobacterium for three days (under low light) and C) spread on antibiotic-containing growth medium. After approximately 4-6 weeks, putative transformants are visible. A final round of selection is recommended to eliminate false-positive transformants.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"protocols-io copy 4.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/it4wjbc6.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/it4ujbc6.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/it4vjbc6.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/it4tjbc6.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6sfcu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8526v","text":"2nd selection (necessary):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9spo7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dahq","text":"To eliminate false positives, after 4 weeks transfer the tissue to fresh growth media containing 100 μg/mL cefotaxime and 10 μg/mL Hygromycin. To facilitate spreading of tissue on the petri dish  add 2 mL of sterile water. Grow at 21°C  under 12 hours light and 12 hours dark, 35 μmol m−2s−1 . Sometimes a 3rd round of selection is necessary.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":286,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":289,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68va6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ep38o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hs59","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13g9g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvags","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"535pe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Anthoceros punctatus (hornwort) transformation
